document_title: External hemorrhoids: Symptoms, treatment, is it dangerous?
subsection_content:
External hemorrhoids are hemorrhoids that originate from the hemorrhoidal veins below the dentate line, and can be accompanied by internal hemorrhoids to form mixed hemorrhoids. These hemorrhoids can be painful and bleed due to blockage and itching.
External hemorrhoids are divided into tufted external hemorrhoids (1, 2, 3 tufts) or the entire anal ring.
